channel.title: [23 MARCH] Zombie horror (BETA Release)
channel.description:
First ever game I've really done from scratch, despite being done in GML, it is 95% code, not using the inbuilt drag and drop actions and events, so I can transfer the concepts to other languages when I get the time :) Based on the CoD nazi zombies, it only features 4 different weapons and 2 rooms at the moment, but the waves of zombies are endless, get increasingly harder to kill, and spawn frequency is increased as the waves progress. Mainly just focused on it being near bug free for the moment before I roll on the fun. [img]http://s15.postimage.org/in9wceqmj/image.png[/img] [img]http://s15.postimage.org/qikfr8097/image.png[/img] [img]http://s17.postimage.org/u1k8bzsyn/image.png[/img] If anyone wants to give it a try: [url=http://up.ht/GNq7kj]http://up.ht/GNq7kj[/url] Read the how to play on the menu first. Criticism much appreciated :) Current version uploaded is 1.0.6. Not sure what's to come in future, probably just more weapons, different levels and probably different powerups. [b]Update log:[/b]
[b]1.0.1 (21/02/2012)[/b] - Menu changes, made it click-able, and the W and S keys can now be used to move up and down. - Pause menu colours changed to look similar to main menu, for consistency. - Arrays for a light machine gun have been added and the weapon changing methods have been modified accordingly, sprite also done. [b]1.0.2 (24/02/2012)[/b] - Reworked the weapon pickup function so it can be used for all weapons by just changing 2 variables in the create event, instead of editing over 20 values in the step event, for each weapon added. As well as using an 'or' operator instead of an 'else if', general cleansing. Fixed a glitch where the question would appear and after clicking yes, ammo was not given. Also made it so when purchasing a weapon, a question appears stating the string name of the weapon. - Added a devmode switch which features a standard console where anything can be changed and spawned, as well as 5 standard key bindings which only work when devmode is enabled (hp, score, kills, max ammo, and nuke). - Modified weapon damages and rates to be more balanced. [b]1.0.3 (01/03/2012)[/b] - Added regenerating health and slightly decreased the rate in which damage is dealt to the player. - Added zombie dying animations, sprite changes, zombie becomes deceased and doesn't move, after two seconds the body disappears. - Ammo crates now disappear after 30 seconds if not picked up, also features a countdown so you can tell when it'll go. - Fixed a bug where if you repair the barricades when they're at full HP they will revert to broken down image state, not sure how I missed that. Also added some messages, and stopped the user losing score when repairing the barricade when at full HP. - Added a question prompt to either play again or exit to menu when player dies. [b]1.0.4 (02/03/2012)[/b] - Added insta kill pickup based on a random timer, this was a huge annoying piece of code to get this working... [b]1.0.5 (06/03/2012)[/b] - Finished off the insta kill pickup including the sprite. - Made the ammo boxes drop similarly to the insta kills, now based on time, not amount of kills. - Modified the nuke command so it can be easily changed to suit a nuke pickup in the future. [b]1.0.6 (23/03/2012) (BETA Release)[/b] - General bug fixes. - Optimised code, got rid of 6 pages of code by rewriting some bits inside function scripts instead of individually in the code. Swapped a huge chunk of if statements for a case switch.
[b]Planned updates:[/b]
- Hiscores menu (top priority). - Player [s]and zombie[/s] dying animations, [s]zombie bodies will disappear after a set time.[/s] - [s]Regenerating health.[/s] - [s]Ammo drops will disappear after a set time if not picked up.[/s] - Shooting animations.
[b]Known bugs/glitches:[/b]
- Player clips and gets stuck with walls occasionally, may try redoing the collision mask. - If you fix the barriers whilst a zombie is on top, the zombie will get stuck. Not too big of an issue as the zombie will just break the wall down then continue walking. - The newly added menu mouse clicking only 'clicks' on what is already selected by the directional or W and S keys, not sure what to do about this yet. - If enter is pressed at any point during the game, the level restarts.
